purpleculture_pinyin:
yǎ
dumb; mute; hoarse; husky; unexploded (of artillery shell etc)
тупой; немой; хриплый; хаски; неразорвавшиеся (от артиллерийского снаряда и т. д.)

yā
(onom.) sound of cawing; sound of infant learning to talk; variant of 呀
(звук.) карканье; звук младенца, обучающегося говорить; вариант 呀
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 哑)
Pictophonetic: 亞 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
啞巴 [ yǎ ba ]: mute; muted; a dumb person; to be dumb
啞口無言 [ yǎ kǒu wú yán ]: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless; at a loss for words

heisig_chinese_memo: Compared to some of the louder places in the world like New York, a lot of the mouths in Asian seem relatively mute.
Ru_trainchinese: yǎ: (прил) немой; безмолвный; (о голосе) хриплый, сиплый; (о бомбе) не взорвавшийся
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Compared to some of the louder places in the world like New York, a lot of the mouths in Asian seem relatively mute.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " mouth " to " sub " sound, which means laughter. It is often used for pronunciation difficulties or inability to speak for some reason. "Shuowen": "Laugh. From the mouth, sub-sound. "The Poem" says: laughter is dumb." It means that laughter is like "Yi·Zhen": "Shock comes to the faint, fear and happiness; laughter is dumb, Later, there is also." Lu Deming quoted Ma Rongyun in his interpretation: "Dumb, laughing." It means that the pronunciation difficulty is like in "Zhan Guo Ce·Zhao Ceyi": "Yuan... swallows charcoal and becomes dumb, changing its pronunciation."

" Dumb " can also be used as an interjection to express amazement. "Han Feizi·Nan Yi": "Shi Kuang said: "Dumb! Whatever is not a monarch!""

" Dumb " can be extended to dim colors. Ming and Song Yingxing "Heavenly Creations of Things-Treating Bronze": "After being hammered, the color of all copper is dull white, and the yellow light is reappeared by the quake.

" Dumb " can also be extended to obscure and difficult to understand. The third fold of the second book of The Western Chamber by Yuan Wang Shifu: "The old lady has no decision to turn to the customs. How can the dumb riddle be guessed."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " mouth ", " sub " sound, which means laughter, often used for difficulty in pronunciation or inability to speak for some reason.
humanum_full_description:
從「口」，「亞」聲，表示笑聲，常用作因故發音困難或不能說話。《說文》：「笑也。从口，亞聲。《詩》曰：笑言啞啞。」 表示笑聲有如《易‧震》：「震來虩虩，恐致福也；笑言啞啞，後有則也。」陸德明釋文引馬融云：「啞啞，笑聲。」表示發音困難有如《戰國策‧趙策一》：「豫讓……又吞炭為啞，變其音。」

　　「啞」亦能作嘆詞，表示驚嘆。《韓非子‧難一》：「師曠曰：『啞！是非君人者之言也！』」

　　「啞」可引申為色彩暗淡。明宋應星《天工開物‧治銅》：「凡銅經錘之後，色成啞白，受鎈復現黃光。」

　　「啞」還可引申為晦澀難明。元王實甫《西廂記》第二本第三摺：「老夫人轉關兒沒定奪，啞謎兒怎猜破。」
humanum_short_description: 從「口」，「亞」聲，表示笑聲，常用作因故發音困難或不能說話。

"The Poem" says: laughter is dumb." It means that laughter is like "Yi·Zhen": "Shock comes to the faint, fear and happiness; laughter is dumb, Later, there is also." Lu Deming quoted Ma Rongyun in his interpretation: "Dumb, laughing." It means that the pronunciation difficulty is like in "Zhan Guo Ce·Zhao Ceyi": "Yuan... swallows charcoal and becomes dumb, changing its pronunciation." 啞字的基本解释

啞
yǎ

啞
yā
均见“哑”。

啞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［è］
［《廣韻》烏格切，入陌，影。］
［《廣韻》於革切，入麥，影。］
亦作“唖1”。“哑1”的繁体字。
笑声。参见“啞啞”、“啞然”。
[②]［yǎ］
［《廣韻》烏下切，上馬，影。］
亦作“唖2”。亦作“瘂1”。“哑2”的繁体字。
(1)由于生理缺陷或疾病而不能说话；发音困难，声音低沉而不圆润。
(2)不说话；没有声音。参见“啞2酒”、“啞2劇”。
(3)指物体发出的声音沉闷，不响声。参见“啞2板”。
(4)指旧体诗中声韵低沉或韵脚多用冷僻字。
(5)谓色彩暗淡，不明亮。
(6)谓使色彩暗淡，不明亮。
(7)比喻隐晦难明。参见“啞2謎”。
(8)蒙骗。
[③]［yā］
［《廣韻》衣嫁切，去禡，影。］
［《集韻》於加切，平麻，影。］
亦作“唖3”。“哑3”的繁体字。
(1)叹词。表示惊叹。
(2)助词。同“呀”。
(3)象声词。

啞字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　啞； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页196第15
【廣韻】烏格切【集韻】乙格切【韻會】【正韻】乙革切，?音?。【說文】笑也。【易·震卦】笑言啞啞。【疏】啞啞，笑語之聲也。【揚子·法言】或人啞爾笑曰：須以發策決科。【集韻】或作䛩。　又【集韻】乙却切，音約。義同。　又【集韻】【類篇】?遏鄂切，音惡。義同。【易林】鳧雁啞啞，以水爲宅，雌雄相和，心志娛樂。宅，達各切。　又【廣韻】烏下切【集韻】【正韻】倚下切【韻會】幺下切，?雅上聲。【玉篇】不言也。【集韻】瘖也。【戰國策】豫讓吞炭爲啞，變其音。【廣韻】同瘂?。　又【集韻】【正韻】於加切【韻會】幺加切，?音鴉。【集韻】啞嘔，小兒學言。　又【淮南子·原道訓】烏之啞啞。【前漢·王吉射烏辭】烏烏啞啞。　又【集韻】衣駕切，音亞。聲也。【韓非子·難一篇】師曠曰：啞，是非君人者之言也。　又【集韻】一曰鳥聲。瘖字原从疒从奢。

考證：〔【集韻】瘏也。〕　謹照原文瘏也改瘖也。

暂无。

dumb
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [è]
["Guangyun" Wu Geqi, enter the Mo, shadow. ]
["Guangyun" Yu Geqie, enter the wheat, and film. ]
Also known as "唖1". The traditional characters of "寫1".
laughter. See "dumb", "dumb".
[②]［yǎ］
["Guangyun" Wuxia cut, mount, shadow. ]
Also known as "唖2". Also known as "sufficiency 1". "Dumb 2" in traditional characters.
(1) Unable to speak due to physical defect or disease; difficulty in pronunciation, low and round voice.
(2) No speech; no voice. See "dumb 2 wine", "dumb 2 drama".
(3) The sound produced by the object is dull and silent. See "Dumb 2 Board".
(4) Refers to the low rhyme in old-style poems or the use of uncommon words in the rhyme.
(5) The color is dim and not bright.
(6) It is said that the color is dim and not bright.
(7) The metaphor is obscure and difficult to understand. See "Dumb 2 Mystery".
(8) Deceived.
[③] [yā]
["Guangyun" Yi marry and cut, go to the 禡, shadow. ]
["Ji Yun" Yu Jiaqie, Ping Ma, Ying. ]
Also known as "唖3". "Dumb 3" in traditional characters.
(1) Interjection. Expressed amazement.
(2) Auxiliary words. Same as "Yeah".
(3) Onomatopoeia.
